bio:
Zhehua Li is currently a Postdoc fellow at NYU Shanghai. He obtained his Ph.D. from University of California, San Diego under the supervision of Prof. Bruce Driver. His research interests lie in the intersection of probability and differential geometry.

Research Interests:

  • Stochastic analysis on manifolds
  • Mallavin calculus
  • SPDE and Mathematical physics
  • Discrete Probability

Courses Taught:

  • Recitation of MATH-SHU 235 Probability and Statistics

  • MATH-SHU 123 Multivariable calculus (Spring 2017) 

Education:

  • BS, Mathematics, Fudan University, China, 2011

  • Ph.D. Mathematics, University of California, San Diego, USA 2016
